item.title: Predicting Arrests - New York City
item.description: In this project, we utilized multiple Machine Learning models to determine the probability of a police procedure ending in an arrest. The dataset used was from the New York Police Department and consisted of data from 2009. The dataset contained various categorical and numerical variables. We performed data cleaning, variable recoding, and removal of irrelevant variables to address the problem at hand. As this problem was proposed by Desaf√≠o Latam, important instructions were provided.
